Text: ...Hyah!
A feint, huh?

You seem to be using your spear's range to reduce my
awareness...but it's pointless.

You're ignoring my feints and narrowly evading my
actual strikes!

Indeed, you are strongâ€”far beyond the level of an
ordinary swordsman or knight.

You've mastered exceptional techniques, and your
combat instincts allow you to wield those techniques
with precision, earning you the title of one of
"Velgalta's Seven Blades"...
But such an assessment is only surface deep...
Ack!
Tsk!
She dodged that?!
No, Alpha must have let her.
An opening!
Sure about that?
Huh?!
Aghh?!
Lady Alpha using a head butt?!
She intentionally hit her right eye... Well played...

Lady Karen knew about the slime sword's properties.
She anticipated Lady Alpha would throw her sword
and follow it with a melee attack.

But Lady Alpha instantly picked up on Lady Karen's
response, closed their distance past sword range, and
countered with a close-quarter physical attack...

When push comes to shove, even Lady Alpha can resort
to close-quarter combat like Lady Delta, using brute
force to overpower her opponent!
...The fight is over.
How did this happen?! I...was powerless!

So long as you're "Karen," you won't be able to
defeat me, the other Seven Shadows, or even
the Garden's Numbers.

This disparity in skill will make you face reality,
as will our slime swords and slime suits...

The Garden's swordsmanship utilizes not just blades
but also fists, kicks, elbows, and knees as part of a
comprehensive attack...

And we also have the power to heal the possessed,
as we did with you...

All of this is due to the "Shadow Wisdom," bestowed
upon us by Shadow, the leader of the Shadow
Garden.
Shadow...!

The Shadow Garden exists to carry out his will...
by destroying the Cult of Diablos and restoring
this world to its natural form.

Lady Karen von Herzog. Discard your name, join the
Shadow Garden, and pledge your allegiance to Shadow.

For there is nothing left of what made you who you
were.
Uaaaaaagghh!!
Oh, now she's crying...
Alpha really beat her through and through!
...But I think it was for the best.
Lady Gamma...

If you know there is something within you that
you just can't let go of, and it's hindering you
from progressing...

Then having someone else sever that connection you're
clinging to can allow you to move forward...
...Lambda. I leave the rest to you.
Sir! Yes sir! I'll start preparing immediately!
Now get up, maggot! Your time as a guest is over!
Agh!

From now on, you're "No. 111"! Discard everything and
become an honest soldier!

U-Understood... I haven't been treated like this
since I was a Velgalta infantry trainee... How I've
fallen...

We'll see how long that attitude lasts. You'll come
to realize your days as an infantry recruit were
heaven compared to what's in store for you.

After three days, you'll forget all about laughing
and crying.
After a week, you'll likely regret having survived!

I... I have a bad feeling about this! What are you
going to do to me?!

...And so, this former Cult of Diablos leader joined
the Shadow Garden...
Um...my lord. Did I read too much into it?

(Um... Beta... This is definitely, um, one of those
classic cases of going overboard!)

(Where delusions and storylines get all mixed up,
making things more and more complex, resulting
in a severe case of self-delusion where every
idea turns into some kind of conspiracy theory!)

(How do you go from some random bandits falling
out to it actually being an undercover infiltration
mission? It's way too unrealistic!)

(It's only natural to panic and backpedal after things
progress into such a grand spectacle epic saga with
intricate storylines and foreshadowing!)

(I mean, come on! The Shadow Garden's actual battles
are really just against bandits and random armed
groups!)
...Beta.
Yes!
Try to keep things simple.
Simple, my lord?

That's right. Simple. It's essential to be straight-
forward and keep to the basics, just like with my
sword technique.
Well...aren't there two sides to every coin?

The reverse of tails is ultimately heads, and the
reverse of heads is ultimately tails.

In other words, no matter how much you overanalyze
something, the outcome will always be one or the
other. Either heads or tails...

And yet, why try to see beyond the reverse of tails?
Ultimately, it will still be heads or tails, nothing
more.
Oh!

Isn't it nonsensical to needlessly complicate the
interpretation of things and lose sight of their
essence?
...Tr-True!

To obtain closure, you can't obsess over something
endlessly... It's essential to firmly draw the line
at the initial point of division!

(I just blurted out a bunch of matter-of-fact lines
to make it sound convincing, but it seems like she
somehow managed to get my point.)

(When self-delusions like this are left unchecked,
they can become the "I get it now... The world is...
Magic is..." sort of nonsense. And things start
spiraling out of control in your head.)

(Yeah, I learned the hard way from my previous life
before reincarnation. It's definitely worth avoiding
certain thoughts!)

Ooh... I could even apply this when coming up with
storylines for my novels!
Exactly. Keep things simple, Beta.
Yes, my lord!
